content: @Eric Wieser has asked for a decision on this one before !4#2450 is merged. @Sebastien Gouezel, you had a look at this earlier, would you be happy to merge?

I'm very much in favor of this change. I have a few nontrivial comments there, though. If this is blocking, I'd be happy to merge and let the comments be handled later, though. @Eric Wieser, how do you want to proceed?
I can address comments in the next few hours
Ideally we would get it into mathlib3 before the next mathport run starts, then I can resync the open mathlib4 PR tomorrow
I'm actually surprised you feel strongly about it; having pushed through with it I'm now only weakly in favor!

I'm generally almost always in favor of the weaker assumptions in definitions and adding back the stronger assumptions in the theorems. And I'm always in favor of getting rid of decidability assumptions.
I'm afraid I'm not in agreement with you about removing the decidability assumptions further to the point of making things non-computable
It's good that we have some mild disagreements :-). Anyway, it's your PR, so you decide, my comments are just suggestions.
basis.det is a gray area; the fact it is non-computable already makes me sad and is something I would want to fix post -port, but is probably not worth worrying about in the short term
I've gone back and added an implementation note to the docstring justifying the choice to quantify over decidable_eq instances in the fields
I'd appreciate if someone could check it makes sense :)
